$!You may need to tell DVLA if you've had a balloon angioplasty (leg).$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You don't need to tell DVLA that you've had any type of angioplasty. 

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You must tell DVLA if you've had a balloon angioplasty.

Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 340KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065302.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: What you need to do about driving if you're had a balloon angioplasty in your leg
title: Balloon angioplasty (leg) and driving
